title: How to Insert an Image on Keynote

steps.headline: Open your computer (MAC OS X 10.5 or later) and click on Go.
steps.description: You will see a drop down list of options. Go to Applications (⇧+⌘+A) highlighted in gray.

steps.headline: Find Keynote.
steps.description: Double-click on it to open it. If you are using Keynote '09 (wooden icon), Keynote will be in a folder called "iWork '09." If you are using Keynote 6 (blue icon), Keynote will be in your Applications folder.

steps.headline: Use the Theme Chooser to pick the theme.
Use Masters to pick the master you should want.
Go to the menu bar.
steps.description: Click on Insert. You will see a drop down list of options.

steps.headline: Go through the drop down list.
steps.description:
Click on the very last option, "Choose…" (⇧+⌘+V)
You will see a list of files on your computer. Look for the image you want and highlight it.

steps.headline: Click Insert to insert the image.
steps.description: Warning: Some pictures are wallpapers that will get too big that will fill up the page.

steps.headline: Resize the picture if needed.
steps.description: There are eight boxes to select from.

text:
Open your computer (MAC OS X 10.5 or later) and click on Go. You will see a drop down list of options. Go to Applications (⇧+⌘+A) highlighted in gray. Find Keynote. Double-click on it to open it. If you are using Keynote '09 (wooden icon), Keynote will be in a folder called "iWork '09." If you are using Keynote 6 (blue icon), Keynote will be in your Applications folder. Use the Theme Chooser to pick the theme.  Use Masters to pick the master you should want.  Go through the list. Look for Blank. Go to the menu bar. Click on Insert. You will see a drop down list of options. Go through the drop down list. Click on the very last option, "Choose…" (⇧+⌘+V)
You will see a list of files on your computer. Look for the image you want and highlight it. Click Insert to insert the image. Warning: Some pictures are wallpapers that will get too big that will fill up the page. Resize the picture if needed. There are eight boxes to select from.
sentences: Open your computer (MAC OS X 10.5 or later) and click on Go.
You will see a drop down list of options.
Go to Applications (⇧+⌘+A) highlighted in gray.
Find Keynote.
Double-click on it to open it.
If you are using Keynote '09 (wooden icon), Keynote will be in a folder called "iWork '09."
If you are using Keynote 6 (blue icon), Keynote will be in your Applications folder.
Use the Theme Chooser to pick the theme.
Use Masters to pick the master you should want.
Go through the list.
Look for Blank.
Go to the menu bar.
Click on Insert.
You will see a drop down list of options.
Go through the drop down list.

Click on the very last option, "Choose…" (⇧+⌘+V)
You will see a list of files on your computer.
Look for the image you want and highlight it.
Click Insert to insert the image.
Warning: Some pictures are wallpapers that will get too big that will fill up the page.
Resize the picture if needed.
There are eight boxes to select from.
